newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai targets $14.5 bln in exports in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai targets $14.5 bln in exports in 1997.

text.p: Shanghai is aiming to achieve $14.5 billion in exports in 1997, up 10 percent from 1996, the Shanghai-based Xinmin Evening News said on Tuesday.
The newspaper said the city government is encouraging companies to export more high-value and high-technology products this year.
The city will also stress reform of export-oriented state-owned companies to make them more competitive on the international markets, the newspaper said.
